ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] all I can say is hmmmm
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, here s the other perspective. I play EQ. My GF saw, wondered why I was on the game for hours, and now plays EQ as well. We have two computers, (Now), and
ygData.messageBody:
Well, here's the other perspective.

I play EQ. My GF saw, wondered why I was on the game for hours, and now plays EQ as well.

We have two computers, (Now), and I would be REALLY glad to get her off mine. I even already bought her
new accounts that I would PL her on. Now I don't have to PL her at all, she can just get transferred.

Personally, I think $50 is no big deal to be able to get my account all to myself and not have to share
computer time on EQ...

Daniel Sniderman wrote:

> If that was a "problem" there would be no selling or e-baying. All accounts
> sold this way require the account to have previously been established with
> the original account owners credit card.
>
> You'll split the chars off to a new account and then sell it.
>
> Long term - this isn't necessarily an e-bay issue - but short term it's a
> huge one. Every person with a reasonably (to very) high level character
> they don't use any more will be tempted to split them off and sell them.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nygaardr, FC3 [mailto:nygaardr@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 06, 2001 4:23 PM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] all i can say is hmmmm
>
> "This should be rather interesting. Power level a char up on a secondary
> account, transfer to a friend that is too slow leveling or something..."
>
> Cant transfer between accounts that are owned by different people (IE
> different billing info including credit card.
>
> Mu
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cyr, Thierry [mailto:thierry.cyr@...]
> Sent: Friday, July 06, 2001 10:09 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: [eqbards] all i can say is hmmmm
>
> https://store.station.sony.com/eq_char_moves/index.jsp
>
> This should be rather interesting. Powerlevel a char up on a secondary
> account, transfer to a friend that is too slow leveling or something...
> Wonder how big an impact this will be to the community. Hmm have a friend
> who quit and doesnt have the heart to start over, no problem, transfer him
> one of your old characters...
>
> 'nuff said
>
> Minkin
> RIP
> A Ro
